timelineItems.text: BWP lucky not to get a yellow card there. How is that our ball? I'll take it! #RBNY

timelineItems.name: Eric Krakauer

timelineItems.name: Christian Sinclair
timelineItems.text: It's a great day for soccer.  #sportingkc

timelineItems.name: Trevor C
timelineItems.text: Not bad seats. #sportingkc

timelineItems.name: Ian Arians
timelineItems.text: I've seen more passion and energy out of our guys in 15 minutes then I did in most of last season #SportingKC

timelineItems.text: #StacheTime #RBNY

timelineItems.name: Deven Archer
timelineItems.text: Zuuuuuusi!! #SKC

Felipe (New York Red Bulls) wins a free kick in the attacking half.

timelineItems.name: Aaron Laver
timelineItems.text: This is where the season starts #RBNY

timelineItems.name: Phil Shore
timelineItems.text: After all the off-season drama, it's time for #RBNY actually show up on the pitch. #ThatsSoMetro

timelineItems.name: Eric Giacometti
timelineItems.text: Strange, but seeing a #RBNY huddle sans Henry seems the weirdest part of his absence tonight #SKCvNY

timelineItems.name: Kyle
timelineItems.text: We're All Part of Verme's Army! #sportingkc #capfedskc @sportingkc

timelineItems.name: Gilad Shapira
timelineItems.text: 1st game of the season...lehgo  #sportingkc

timelineItems.comment: Match ends, Sporting Kansas City 1, New York Red Bulls 1.

timelineItems.name: Nicholas Weber
timelineItems.text: Very entertaining second half. I'll take a point. #SportingKC

timelineItems.name: just tolstoy
timelineItems.text: I'll take the point #RBNY

timelineItems.name: papaswank
timelineItems.text: game over #NYRB excellent way to tie the game

timelineItems.name: Matt Binder
timelineItems.text: Not good enough ##RBNY

timelineItems.name: AJ Cheeseburgerwitz
timelineItems.text: not overly optimistic about this team this year. I miss you @ThierryHenry, so so much. #RBNY

timelineItems.name: Kenny
timelineItems.text: Very mixed feelings about the opener...it's a long season and there is a lot to improve on here #RBNY

timelineItems.name: ThisIsSporting.com
timelineItems.text: So #SportingKC gets a point with the 1-1 draw, down a man for about 20 minutes. Plenty of missed chances though. Who will start converting?

timelineItems.name: Capo on Sabbatical
timelineItems.text: Haha #NYCFC blew their lead and dropped two points. #RBNY came from behind on the road for a well deserved point. Good job boys.

timelineItems.name: Beth Salvato
timelineItems.text: I'll take the draw at #SKC. No problem with that for the first game. #RBNY

timelineItems.name: Kyle Seiwert
timelineItems.text: Dropped points at home. The beat goes on. #sportingKC #MLS

timelineItems.name: Mike Ferlita
timelineItems.text: Frustrating game for the boys. Never a bad thing to snag a point on the road. #NYRB @NewYorkRedBulls

timelineItems.name: New York Red Bulls
timelineItems.text: FULLTIME: The Red Bulls and @SportingKC are level with a 1-1 draw at the whistle. #SKCvNYR

timelineItems.name: Viking Jesus
timelineItems.text: You're always ok with a point on the road. Always. Not a bad start to the season. #RBNY

timelineItems.name: Austin Fido
timelineItems.text: Much to improve on, but 1-1 on the road is a good result. Gotta figure out what you're doing with BWP, Jesse. #KCvNY #RBNY

timelineItems.desc: A pair of clubs who last faced each other in the MLS Cup Playoffs open the 2015 season against each other when Sporting Kansas City play host to the New York Red Bulls.
timelineItems.title: HIGHLIGHTS: Sporting Kansas City vs New York Red Bulls | March 8, 2015

timelineItems.name: Andy Edwards
timelineItems.text: Dia confident playing himself out of trouble…a little too confident, played himself back into trouble. Not afraid as a rookie. #SportingKC

Foul by Bradley Wright-Phillips (New York Red Bulls).

timelineItems.name: Tim Blaise
timelineItems.text: Glad to see Opara score, really like him #SKC

timelineItems.name: Mike McGuire
timelineItems.text: Opara heads in a picture perfect cross from Feilhaber to give #SKC the lead could have a breakout season if he stays fit this yr #SKCvNYRB

timelineItems.comment: Attempt saved. Chris Duvall (New York Red Bulls) right footed shot from long range on the right is saved in the bottom left corner. Assisted by Lloyd Sam with a headed pass.

timelineItems.name: supporter
timelineItems.text: Yeah Sammy! #RBNY

timelineItems.text: Yeeeeeaaaaaaaaasssssssssssssssssssssssss #rbny

timelineItems.text: Hell Yeah @MrLloydSam #RBNY

timelineItems.text: both of those goals were sick #SKCvNYR

timelineItems.name: Anthony Russello
timelineItems.text: LLOYD SAM WITH THE SCREAMER FROM DISTANCE #RBNY

timelineItems.name: Gary Hampson
timelineItems.text: Anything Mix can do, Lloyd can do better. #RBNY

timelineItems.name: Tim Armstrong
timelineItems.text: If you bet Opara would produce #SKC's first goal of 2015, you're either prescient, or (more likely) clinically insane. Either way, enjoy it.

timelineItems.name: Joe Prince-Wright
timelineItems.text: Lloyd Sam, take a bow. What a hit as #SKC's lead lasts less than 5 mins. 1-1 at Sporting Park as #RBNY equalize in fine fashion. #MLS

timelineItems.name: Matt Johnson
timelineItems.text: Bradley Wright Phillips won't be the same without Thierry Henry. #SKCvNYR

timelineItems.comment: Offside, New York Red Bulls. Chris Duvall tries a through ball, but Bradley Wright-Phillips is caught offside.

timelineItems.name: laura mcfayden
timelineItems.text: Anor out for Nagamura. Business #SKCvNYR

timelineItems.name: Ed Rowe
timelineItems.text: Impressive shift from Anor. Liked the selection. #SKC

timelineItems.comment: Attempt missed. Graham Zusi (Sporting Kansas City) left footed shot from the left side of the six yard box is close, but misses the top left corner. Assisted by Dominic Dwyer with a headed pass.

timelineItems.name: Johnny Vilchez
timelineItems.text: We need to get Grella out for Soltz or Zizzo. #RBNY #SKCvRBNY

timelineItems.name: Alex Gold
timelineItems.text: 54th consecutive sellout tonight at Sporting Park. 19,784 in attendance. #sportingkc

timelineItems.name: laura mcfayden
timelineItems.text: That would have been beautiful from Zusi had it gone it... But it didn't. #SKCvNYR

timelineItems.text: Take Felipe off, bring Dane on, play a 4132 with Grella up top with BWP #RBNY

timelineItems.text: SO CLOSE ZUSI! #SKCvNYR

timelineItems.comment: Attempt missed. Dominic Dwyer (Sporting Kansas City) header from the centre of the box misses to the left. Assisted by Graham Zusi with a cross.

timelineItems.name: Jeremiah
timelineItems.text: Lack of width in the #RBNY team is killing any space BWP could play in. Hard to see him with so few touches #SKCvNYRB

timelineItems.text: Felipe you're killing me! #NYRB

timelineItems.name: Scott Shields
timelineItems.text: Love the Zizzo for Grella sub. Hope this pays off for #RBNY.

timelineItems.text: Sal Zizzo is on the field in an #RBNY kit. I don't like it. #SKCvNYR

timelineItems.name: Allan Lewis
timelineItems.text: Good shift from Grella - didn't set the world on fire, but was all over the place #RBNY #SKCvRBNY

timelineItems.name: John
timelineItems.text: Great sub. Grella looks way off. Hopefully it's just this game and not him or else I'm really worried #RBNY #MLS

timelineItems.desc: Second yellow card to Matt Besler (Sporting Kansas City) for a bad foul.
timelineItems.title: RED CARD: Matt Besler picks up a second yellow card for a challenge on Wright-Phillips

timelineItems.title: SAVE: Luis Robles dives to parry away a dipping Sinovic shot

timelineItems.name: ThisIsSporting.com
timelineItems.text: Couple shaky kicks from Marin early in this one. But out in good time on two other balls. #SportingKC

timelineItems.comment: Corner,  Sporting Kansas City. Conceded by Sacha Kljestan.

timelineItems.name: Kamal Hylton
timelineItems.text: Completely forgot Felipe is on #RBNY now, he and Kljestan combining should be interesting. #SKCvNYRB #MLS

timelineItems.comment: Foul by Ronald Zubar (New York Red Bulls).

timelineItems.name: Eric Giacometti
timelineItems.text: Perhaps the biggest question mark for #RBNY in preseason was left wing... Grella with the start, no Zizzo on to relieve him #SKCvNY

timelineItems.comment: Bradley Wright-Phillips (New York Red Bulls) wins a free kick in the defensive half.
Foul by Matt Besler (Sporting Kansas City).

timelineItems.name: Isaac
timelineItems.text: Marsch just subbed off the guy obviously having trouble. That's a plus in my book. #RBNY

timelineItems.name: Tate Steinlage
timelineItems.text: Besler is gone. Picks up his second yellow card. Sporting KC will play down a man for the final 20 minutes. #SportingKC

timelineItems.name: Andy Edwards
timelineItems.text: Second red for Matt Besler, and the final 20 minutes of this game just got verrrrryyyyy interesting. #SportingKC #SKCvNYR

timelineItems.name: DanDanDan
timelineItems.text: Need to change formation. BWP on his own upfront is not working #NYRB #SKCvNYR

timelineItems.name: Ian Arians
timelineItems.text: So #SportingKC lost both center backs today 😅

timelineItems.name: Derbside Pickup
timelineItems.text: Ref punishing Besler for that commercial #RBNY

timelineItems.name: Seán Paull
timelineItems.text: Going downhill fast for #SKC... Lead for a couple mins and now down to 10. Big chance for #RBNY

timelineItems.name: Eric Giacometti
timelineItems.text: Does Marsch go for the win on the road now that #SKC are down to 10? His late game subs will tell the tale #RBNY #SKCvNY

timelineItems.text: #SKC should be winning. I'd be happy with a draw at this point #RBNY #MLS
